title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations:

For Task A1, the response must correctly describe one steps in the process of selecting the British prime minister.

For Task A2, the response must correctly describe a second step in the process of selecting the British prime minister.

For Task B, the response must correctly explain how the selection process for the British prime minister reflects a fusion of power.

For Task C, the response must correctly describe a step in the process of selecting the Mexican president.

For Task D, the response must correctly explain how the selection process for the Mexican president reflects a separation of power.

Points for each Task are earned independently of each other.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes five of the tasks set by the question.
